Name: Reporting parking complaints to 311.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting parking complaints to 311

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill would require 311 to accept complaints and photographs related to illegal parking and the misuse of parking permits. The City would be required to report on complaints about City vehicles blocking a bike lane, bus lane, crosswalk, sidewalk, or fire hydrant.

\v0\par
\pard\ltrpar\noline\hyphpar0\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone Section 1. Chapter 3 of title 23 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 23-304 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 23-304 Parking complaints. a. The department of information technology and telecommunications shall implement and maintain on its 311 citizen center website and mobile device platforms the capability for the public to file a complaints under the category of \ldblquote illegal parking.\rdblquote\par
b. Within such category, the public shall have the ability to submit complaints regarding improper use of a parking permit and complaints for parking in any of the following locations:\par
1. parking in \ldblquote no standing\rdblquote  area;\par
2. parking in \ldblquote no stopping\rdblquote  area;\par
3. parking on sidewalk;\par
4. parking in crosswalk;\par
5. parking in front of fire hydrant;\par
6. parking at bus stop;\par
7. parking in bus lane;\par
8. parking in bicycle lane;\par
9. parking as to obstruct a driveway; and\par
10. double parking.\par
c. With respect to complaints filed pursuant to subdivision b, the public shall have ability to:  \par
1. include information about whether the vehicles used were operated on behalf of the city; and\par
2. submit photographic evidence supporting such complaint.\par
d. 1. The resolution of a complaint submitted pursuant to subdivision b alleging improper use of a parking permit shall be sent to the individual filing such complaint within eight hours. \par
2. On a monthly basis, no later than February 15, 2020, the department of information technology and telecommunications shall publish a report containing data for the previous month that shall include, but not be limited to, the number of complaints of illegal parking of vehicles operated on behalf of the city in the types of locations set forth in subdivision b.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
